bug_description:
Bug Description:

Bug ID: 45

The bug is located in the Jsoup project. The type of the bug is SL SH SF. 

Issue:
The test error message we receive is a junit.framework.AssertionFailedError where the output was expected to be <1> but was returned as <5>. The main cause of this issue can be traced back to the incorrect code used within an if statement.

Problematic Code:
The problematic code lies in this line - `} else if (("td".equals(name) || "td".equals(name) && !last)) {`. Here, the developer is checking if the name equals "td" or if name equals "td" again but the last value is false. This could most likely be a typo or a misunderstanding because the name is being checked to be the same twice.

Implication:
This error causes the method resetInsertionMode() to possibly transition to the wrong state since the condition always checks for the same value twice for "td".

Fix:
In the fixed code, the else if condition is corrected to `} else if (("td".equals(name) || "th".equals(name) && !last)) {`. Here the "td" is corrected to "th". Now, the condition will check if the name equals "td" or "th" and the last value is false. Therefore, it makes more sense logically and leaves less room for error, as it covers separate conditions for when the name value equals either "td" or "th", enabling the function to transition to the correct HtmlTreeBuilderState.
